actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on February 6, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Jenniffer Gonzalez-Colon. Mrs. Gonzalez-Colon submitted her resignation from the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology. The resignation was accepted without objection.

actions-list.header: Governing Board of the Office of Congressional Ethics
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 4(d) of House Resolution 5, 118th Congress, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker after consultation with the Minority Leader appointed Mr. Paul D. Vinovich, District of Columbia, Chair, Mr. Leon Acton Westmoreland, Georgia, and Ms. Karen L. Haas, Maryland. After consultation with the Speaker the Minority Leader appointed Mr. Michael D. Barnes, Florida, Co-Chair, Mr. William Paul Luther, Minnesota, and Ms. Lorraine C. Miller, Texas.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Scalise asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Thursday, February 2, 2023, it adjourn to meet at noon on Monday, February, 6, 2023 for Morning-Hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
The Chair recognized Mr. Scalise for the purpose of engaging in a colloquy with Ms. Clark (MA) on the expectations regarding the legislative schedule for the House during the upcoming week.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 328
actions-list.actionItem: 86, 14 Present (Roll no. 106).
Considered as unfinished business. H. Con. Res. 9 — "Denouncing the horrors of socialism."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218
actions-list.actionItem: 211, 1 Present (Roll no. 105).
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule on the resolution and the preamble.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 76.

Rule provides for consideration of H. Con. Res. 9 and H. Res. 76. All points of order against consideration and provisions are waived and are considered as read. Rule also provides for one hour of general debate on each resolution.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 83. H. Res. 76 — "Removing a certain Member from a certain standing committee of the House."

At the conclusion of debate on H. Con. Res. 9, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McHenry demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule on the resolution and the preamble.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Con. Res. 9.

Rule provides for consideration of H. Con. Res. 9 and H. Res. 76. All points of order against consideration and provisions are waived and are considered as read. Rule also provides for one hour of general debate on each resolution.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 83. H. Con. Res. 9 — "Denouncing the horrors of socialism."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Casar to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mike Bost to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
